conclusion: The problem involves analyzing the motion of a charged particle in two magnetic fields, B1 and B2, where B1 = 2B2.
The particle enters the magnetic field B1 perpendicularly at point O and experiences circular motion due to the magnetic force.
The radius of the circular path in a magnetic field can be determined using the formula r = mv / qB.
The radii of the circular paths in the two fields are in the ratio r1 : r2 = 1 : 2 because B1 = 2B2.
The time taken for one complete revolution in a magnetic field is given by T = 2πm / qB.
For the field B1, the time for one complete revolution is T1 = 2πm / qB1.
For the field B2, the time for one complete revolution is T2 = 2πm / qB2.
Since B1 = 2B2, T1 = πm / qB2 and T2 = 2πm / qB2.
The time for the particle to travel from O to the point where it re-enters B1 is half the period in B1, which is T1 / 2.
The time for the particle to travel from the re-entry point to O is half the period in B2, which is T2 / 2.
The total time T_total is T1 / 2 + T2 / 2 = πm / 2qB2 + 2πm / 2qB2 = 3πm / 2qB2.
Substituting B2 = B1 / 2 into the expression, T_total = 3πm / qB1.
The time it takes for the particle to pass through point O downward again is 3πm / qB1.
